{"success":true,"issue":{"number":68,"title":"Expand MVP requirements: interactive components, navigation, and design language consistency","state":"OPEN","labels":["ai-authored","area:sbs","housekeeping"],"url":"https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/issues/68","body":"MVP requirements should be expanded beyond current scope to include:

- **Working, bug-free interactive components** - toggles, modals, collapsibles, and other interactive elements must function correctly
- **Blueprint navigation** - inter-page navigation should work reliably (sidebar, breadcrumbs, chapter links)
- **Design language consistency** - visual coherence across all page types (dashboard, paper, blueprint, dep graph, PDF)
- **Object permanence** - UI elements should behave predictably across pages; consistent placement, styling, and behavior of shared components (headers, sidebars, toggles, theme switches)
- **Inter-page design coherence** - transitions between page types should feel unified, not like separate applications

This is about raising the bar from "pages render" to "the product feels like a cohesive, polished tool.". We operationalize that by reading and expanding /Users/eric/GitHub/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/dev/markdowns/living/MVP.md accordingly

---

{"success":true,"issue":{"number":109,"title":"MVP scope: desktop-only focus + remove verso-native generation from surfaces","state":"OPEN","labels":["ai-authored","origin:agent","behavior","area:sbs:css","area:lean:verso","scope:cross-repo"],"url":"https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/issues/109","body":"## Scope Decisions

### 1. Desktop/Landscape Only
All design and validation targets desktop/landscape only. This tool serves people writing math papers/code -- no one is going to look at this on their phone. Mobile responsiveness is out of scope for MVP.

### 2. Remove Verso-Native Generation from MVP Surfaces
Remove all verso-native generation from MVP-visible surfaces (dashboard, sidebar, compliance, docs). The underlying Lean infrastructure and tooling is preserved for future use, but all user-facing mentions should be scrubbed.

Key context: sharing is imminent (hours away). There are plenty of impressive things to show without verso-native generation, which has known issues and won't be ready in time.

---
